item.title: Possible Heading
item.dc:creator: rulecheck
item.content:encoded:
Passed Tests

Blockquote

Code is poetry.

Matt Mullenweg

Large text longer than 50 characters (core typography styles)

WordPress, an open-source content management system, empowers users worldwide to create websites ranging from simple blogs to complex e-commerce platforms.

Large text longer than 50 characters (inline styles)

WordPress is an open-source content management system. It empowers users worldwide to create really awesome websites from simple blogs to complex e-commerce platforms.

Short phrase formated like body text

You should try WordPress now.

Short phrase, same size as body but bold.

You should download WordPress now.

Short phrase, same size as body but italicized.

Thanks for emailing us.

Inline font-size 18px

About Accessibility Checker

Failed Tests

Inline font-size 20px

Possible Heading 1

Multiple examples of font-size 16px and bold or italic inline styles

Possible Heading 2

Possible Heading 3

Possible Heading 4

Possible Heading 5

Possible Heading 6

Possible Heading 7

Possible Heading 8

Multiple examples or font-size 16px and bold or italic HTML tags

Possible Heading 9

Possible Heading 10

Possible Heading 11

Possible Heading 12

Core paragraph block L (CSS variables)

Possible Heading 13

Core paragraph block XL (CSS variables)

Possible Heading 14

Core paragraph block XXL (CSS variables)

Possible Heading 15

item.dc:creator: rulecheck
item.content:encoded:
Passing Tests

Multiple Labels

Billing
Name

Address

Associating Headings With Regions

Wild fires spread across the San Diego Hills

Strong winds expand fires ignited by high temperatures ...

Calendar

This calendar shows the game schedule for the Boston Red Sox.

...

Button with aria-describedby

Closing this window will discard any information entered and
return you back to the main page

Failing Tests

Multiple Labels, One Missing

Billing
Name

Multiple Labels, Both Missing

Address

Associating Headings With Regions - ID empty

Wild fires spread across the San Diego Hills

Strong winds expand fires ignited by high temperatures ...

Button with typo in aria-describedby

Closing this window will discard any information entered and
return you back to the main page

item.title: Missing Form Label
item.dc:creator: rulecheck
item.content:encoded:
Passing Tests

Explicit association using "for" and "id" attributes

Implicit association by wrapping the input with a label element

Implicit association by wrapping the input with a label element (input is not direct descendant)

Using an aria-label

Using aria-labelledby

Input type=submit

Input type=button with value

Input type=hidden

Input type=image with alt

Failing Tests

No matching for attribute

For and ID mismatch

No label, only placeholder

Empty aria-label

Empty aria-labelledby

This will also flag a Broken Aria Reference error.

Image input without alt

This will also flag an Image Missing Alternative Text error.

Image input with empty alt

This will also flag an Image Empty Alternative Text warning.

item.dc:creator: rulecheck
item.content:encoded:
Passed Tests

Link in paragraph with anchor

Read the article, Ambiguous Links, on The Admin Bar.

Website domain without protocol or path

You can download WordPress free from WordPress.org.

Website domain without protocol or path but with punctuation

If it seems overwhelming to download WordPress from WordPress.org, get hosted WordPress at WordPress.com.

Website domain without protocol and only one path

Learn more at equalizedigital.com/accessibility-checker.

Don't miss upcoming meetups. Register to attend at equalizedigital.com/meetup.

Link in button block

Download Accessible PDF

item.title: Ambiguous Anchor Text
item.dc:creator: rulecheck
item.content:encoded:
Passes

String in Paragraph

This is a rule in the Accessibility Checker plugin by Equalize Digital. To learn more about Equalize Digital click here. The plugin is free on WordPress.org.

String in core button

Learn more about us

String in core button with screen reader text

Keep reading about Equalize Digital

Failures

Specific Strings

  1. Click Here
  2. Here
  3. Go Here
  4. More
  5. More...
  6. Details
  7. More Details
  8. Link
  9. This page
  10. Continue
  11. Continue Reading
  12. Read More
  13. Open
  14. Download
  15. Button
  16. Keep Reading
  17. Learn More

String in a paragraph

To learn more about Equalize Digital click here.

String in a paragraph with punctuation

Equalize Digital is awesome. Learn more.

String in core button

Learn More
Download

String with SVG

More

item.title: Reading Level High & Simplified Summary Reading Level Low
item.dc:creator: rulecheck
item.content:encoded:
Ensuring digital inclusivity through website accessibility entails the meticulous integration of features and functionalities that facilitate seamless interaction and comprehension for individuals encompassing a diverse spectrum of physical and cognitive abilities. This imperative encompasses the optimization of web content to adhere to universally accepted standards, such as the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG), which delineate criteria for perceivability, operability, and understandability. Robust adherence to these guidelines necessitates the implementation of intricate design elements, including but not limited to alternative text for multimedia assets, keyboard navigation compatibility, and judicious utilization of color contrasts to accommodate users with visual impairments.

Furthermore, the paramount objective lies in mitigating barriers to information access, engendering an equitable virtual milieu wherein all users, irrespective of disabilities, can navigate digital landscapes with efficacy. An assiduous approach toward website accessibility not only aligns with ethical imperatives but also serves as a legal requisite in numerous jurisdictions. It is an endeavor that beckons web developers and designers to transcend conventional paradigms, instigating a paradigm shift towards an inclusive digital ecosystem where the vast tapestry of human diversity is not merely acknowledged but celebrated through a confluence of sophisticated design principles and comprehensive adherence to accessibility benchmarks.

This is a link to wma website and and mpg website link too.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Websites should work for people. People with disabilities matter. Web Content Accessibility Guidelines help you make your website work for everyone. There are lots of ways to make websites accessible. Add text that describes images. Make sure they work with a keyboard. Have good color contrast. It is the right thing to do.

Link

item.title: Underlined Text
item.dc:creator: rulecheck
item.content:encoded:
Our Hearts Sparkle for These Veterans in Fredericksburg throughout February

Throughout the month of February, many businesses have teamed up with the Washington-Lewis chapter of the National Society Daughters of the American Revolution to honor their favorite veterans in Fredericksburg. This movement is called “Our Hearts Sparkle for These Veterans.”

Participating businesses decorate their windows in honor of the veterans that they celebrate. The window displays will be up from February 2-26, and each will honor a specific veteran with their photo and story of heroism. This year, there will be a contest to award the Best Window Display.

“When I created this event, my goal was to showcase local veterans and say a HUGE THANK YOU for their Service,” Committee Chairman Kim Harmon said. “Veterans are some of the humblest folks I know…I’m deeply grateful for them and their families’ sacrifice to keep us and our country safe. ”

“Our Hearts Sparkle for These Veterans” is a great way for local businesses to support the troops, and supporting these businesses is a great way to celebrate those in uniform.

Some extra text added with an underline that should fail 2 times in the PHP and the same 2 elements should fail in the JS checks.
